review: Say to Blizzard's Bobby Cardik, the hybridization experiment report of the deformed species Experimental subject: Your dad Experimental process: Release your dad from the dog cage. After fixing your dad with nails, sawing his skull open to reveal his brain. Unique brain cells are found and extracted in unidentified biological feces within the skull. (Your dad has died in the process) brain nuclei are extracted and implanted into the eggs of maggots. Name it you. Soak in magma, put it in the oven and bake it continuously at a high temperature of 200 degrees Celsius, waiting for it to develop. Result: You eventually develop into a deformed creature with a bright green body with a human maggot head and a maggot tail. Studies have found that you feed on.
OW2 is a shell of the original Overwatch thats now used to shove microtransactions down the players throats.

I hate these games. I like it TTeam Fortress 2

I've a lot to say about OW, having about 4000h on Bnet. Yea, I didn't play it on here just left it running so I can write a review, and I am butthurt that they didn't give me a refund. Doesn't make my opinion less informed. 

I think Totalbiscuit had gone at this point, but it was his vision that cosmetic lootboxes were not that bad, really, and they just up and ran away with that, without doing market research, without stopping to consider problem gamblers and the normalization of wanton consumerism. 

When it first came out it was exactly what I was looking for - Casual and Fun. Then they added ranked, pretty much for the same reason PUBG did - all the esports money, in a game which was not even remotely geared towards competitive play. That was the first nail in the coffin, and mind, this was before we knew Blizz was a greedy, abusive human rights violation strewn together with abuse of creative vision and frat boy culture.

Second mistake is trying to promote it as an esport. Just disingenuous at this point. It left such a sour taste in my mouth that I think I may have stopped around that time, or at least started dicking around more and not playing seriously. I don't even know what they were thinking, because the skins were butt ugly. I think someone in a boardroom told a middle manager to 'somehow raise engagement with the product' and when the guy complained that he did not know how they corporate-abused him into taking responsibility for it and probably fired him when it failed. Blizz is just so scummy now. Probably always was, but we were all so enchanted by their creative powah that we were just smitten by the art.

Anyway, the esport thing, when they did balance changes made the game unfun. This I think was the turning point. They were so cock sure that the player base will carry the game that they made it unfun for the sake of BaLaNcE, which they read on reddit is important for competitive games LOL, not understanding that they had just cut off the branch they were standing on. I completely stopped playing then.

I did occasionally dip into it on Saturdays with me mates. At some point we even did 6x6 closed lobby, just on disc, drinking beer and having fun.

Then they took OW away, and replaced it with the same skin, only with engine modifications that favor competitive play and are just unfun, and make the game play like you're in a bathtub out at sea. So yea I requested a refund, but, ofc, I am ineligible because I've a billion hours and "have had my money's worth". But its more than that. They gave me something I love and then they took it away from me. Because of simple human greed, they shot eachother in the foot. So yea I am entitled to have something back so I can move on,

This game should have remained as Project Titan. Imagine exploring that handsome world, with a character that has Gengi's movement. Funny thing is, I think the 5 or so original levels were proof of concept levels for project Titan and besides writing the mp code they didn't really do anything. Its just a skeleton crew of artists that pump out skins sand that's it. Occasionally a coked up exec uses RNG to re-generate the game balance to simulate updates lol.

OK I'll stop now, not as if anyones gonna read this far lol.
It used to be my favorite game
